alert.note: Alert for Posey (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 9:13PM EST until further notice by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky...Illinois... Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam and Shawneetown. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following river in Indiana... Kentucky... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam and Mount Vernon. .Recent heavy rains in the Ohio River basin are expected to cause rises in the river with multiple locations rising above flood stage this week. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at J.T. Myers Dam. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM CST Sunday the stage was 31.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Tuesday afternoon and continue rising to a crest of 43.0 feet Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 37.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
